medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric non-radiating abdominal pain exacerbated by eating/drinking for the past week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports a new onset of bilateral lower extremity swelling for two weeks and epigastric pain that began one week ago, worsened by eating. She has experienced a few episodes of non-bilious, non-bloody vomiting, no diarrhea, and has lost weight over the past week. The abdominal pain is worse compared to prior examinations by other doctors.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Breast cancer, peptic ulcer disease, hepatitis C virus (HCV), stage 3 chronic kidney disease (CKD) due to biopsy-proven focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS), gastrointestinal reflux disease (GERD), chronic pain, and depression.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of lung cancer. Siblings died from cancer of unknown source. Brother has diabetes.
medical_history.social_history: No history of smoking or alcohol use. No foreign travel or trauma reported.
